cnd 0.0.0.9002
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Document your conditions

    cnd_document.Rd

    Documents your conditions() and conditions()

    cnd_document(
  package = get_package(),
  registry = package,
  file = file.path("R", paste0(package, "-cnd-conditions.R")),
  cleanup = TRUE
)

cnd_section(fun)

    Arguments

    package

    The package to document

    registry

    The name of the registry

    file

    The file to save the documentation. This can be a file path, a connection object, or NULL. When file is a path, the directory of the path is searched for files containing # % Generated by cnd: do not edit by hand. These are removed if they are not the same as the generated documentation.

    cleanup

    If FALSE will not remove files containing # % Generated by cnd: do not edit by hand

    fun

    The name of a function

    Value

    • cnd_document() Conditional on the file argument:

      • when file is a connection, the connection object

      • when file is a path, the path

      • when file is NULL, a character vector of the documentation

      • if no conditions are found, a warning is thrown and NULL is returned

    • cnd_section() A character vector of the documentation

    conditions

    Conditions are generated through the {cnd} package. The following conditions are associated with this function:

    For more conditions, see:

    Examples

    file <- file()
cnd_document("cnd", file = file)
readLines(file)

cnd_section("cnd")
#> [1] "\nConditions are generated through the [`{cnd}`][cnd::cnd-package] package.\nThe following conditions are associated with this function:\n\n\\describe{\n  \n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:as_character_cnd_error/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    You cannot coerce a [cnd::condition_generator] object to a character. This may have occurred when trying to put a condition function through [stop()] or [warning].  Instead, call the function first, then pass the result to [stop()] or [warning()].\n\nFor example:\n```r\n\n# Instead of this\nstop(my_condition)\n\n# Do this\nstop(my_condition())\n\n```\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:cnd_document_conditions/\033[33mwarning\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    \n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:cnd_document_file/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    \n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:cnd_document_pkg_reg/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    \n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:cnd_generated_cleanup/\033[34mmessage\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    \n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:cnd_generated_write/\033[90mcondition\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    \n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:cond_cnd_class/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    [cnd()] simple calls the appropriate function: [stop()], [warning()], or [message()] based on the `type` parameter from [cnd::condition()].\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:condition_message_generator/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    'cnd::condition_generator' objects are not conditions.   You may have made this mistake: \n\n```r\n\nx <- condition(\"my_condition\")\nconditionMessage(x)\n\n```\n\nCondition generators need to be called first before they can be used as conditions.  Try this instead:\n\n```r\n\nx <- condition(\"my_condition\")\nconditionMessage(x())\n\n```\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:condition_overwrite/\033[33mwarning\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    \n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:conditions_dots/\033[33mwarning\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    The `...` parameter in [conditions()] is meant for convenience.  Only a single argument is allowed.  Other parameters must be named  explicitly.\n\nFor example:\n\n```r\n\n# Instead of this\nconditions(\"class\", \"package\") # \"package\" is ignored with a warning\n\n# Do this\nconditions(class = \"class\", package = \"package\")\n\n```\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:invalid_condition/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    The `class`, `exports`, and `help` parameters must be a single character string.  If you are passing a function, it must be a valid function.\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:invalid_condition_message/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    Conditions messages are displayed when invoked through [conditionMessage()].  You can set a static message by passing through a `character` vector, or a dynamic message by passing through a `function`.  The function should return a `character` vector.\n\nWhen `message` is not set, a default \"there was an error\" message is used.\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:match_arg/\033[31merror\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    Mostly [match.arg()] but with a custom condition\n  }\n\n  \\item{[`\033[1mcnd\033[22m:no_package_exports/\033[33mwarning\033[39m`][cnd-cnd-conditions]}{\n    The `exports` parameter requires a `package`\n  }\n\n}\n\nFor more conditions, see: [cnd-cnd-conditions]\n"
